Description: Ostracon, small fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel (see also 1923,0327.127.a), the fabric is partially grey in section, interior covered with a dark-brown deposit, exterior covered with a red-brown slip and the beginnings of three lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing an account of uncertain character.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.126)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36332) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36332)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 150 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
